text:
e="preserve">Cat Bordhi was a teacher, author, and knitting expert. She changed how people knit socks and scarves. She was very influential in the knitting community. She self-published books that opened up a very closed and tightly controlled knitting publishing industry.
She also wrote a novel called "Treasure Forest". It was a Nautilus Book Award winner in 2004.
She was born 2 March 1951 in San Francisco, California. She died 19 September 2020 at home in Friday Harbor, Washington. She was 69 years old.
